item.title: Wtf? How to get no errors when removing
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

all that command did was make it give name and reason as to why the person was banned… a very similar command is in rsc servers as well

and you probably deleted something such as a } or a { and thats why its all messed up…

Read full topic
item.source: Wtf? How to get no errors when removing

item.title: Wtf? How to get no errors when removing
item.dc:creator: @HiddenPker HiddenPker
item.description:
@HiddenPker wrote:

Ok this is the weirdest thing ever my mate said “oh add this”

} */ if(command.startsWith("banuser") && playerRights > 1) { try { StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(command, "-"); if(st.countTokens() == 3) { st.nextToken(); String username = st.nextToken(); String reason = st.nextToken(); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(username); for(int pU = 0; pU < protectedUsers.length; pU++) { if(username.equalsIgnoreCase(protectedUsers[pU])) { sM("That is a protected user!"); return; } } if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; writeLog(p.playerName, "bans"); p.playerReason = reason; p.savegame(false); p.disconnected = true; sM("Banning the user " + username + " for " + reason); } } else { sM("SYNTAX - ::banuser-name-reason"); } } catch (Exception e) { } }

Now it says when to ban some1 SYNTAX - ::banuser-name-reason
also when I try to ban some if i add a ban cmd and name is ::ban instead of banuser it doesnt… is it because of the stupid cmd?
when I try it… it doesnt when I come to delete it I get 100 errors and I never get errors… ardlyy

Read full topic
item.source: Wtf? How to get no errors when removing
